lead_intro: Have you ever wondered about the history and future of global population growth? Dive into the four stages of the demographic transition and discover how it impacts our world!

quiz.question: What was the main reason families used to have lots of children during the first stage of the demographic transition?
quiz.explanation: During the first stage, high child mortality rates meant families had many children to ensure some survived to adulthood.

quiz.question: At which stage of the demographic transition did the UK experience a population explosion?
quiz.explanation: The UK experienced a population explosion during the second stage when better living conditions led to fewer deaths and a rapid increase in population.

quiz.question: What caused the population growth to slow down in the third stage of the demographic transition?
quiz.explanation: In the third stage, decreased fertility rates led to a balance between births and deaths, resulting in a slowdown in population growth.

quiz.question: Why is the population still growing rapidly even though birth rates have dropped significantly?
choices: Children of the previous generation having their own kids
quiz.answer: Children of the previous generation having their own kids
quiz.explanation: The population continues to grow due to the children born during the population explosion having their own children, albeit at a lower rate than their parents.

quiz.question: Which statement best describes the future of global population growth according to the video?
choices: It will lead to chaos and violence
It will result in a massive decline in education
It will eventually come to an end
quiz.answer: It will eventually come to an end
quiz.explanation: The video suggests that global population growth will eventually come to an end, with forecasts indicating that the 12th billionth human may never be born.
